page.title: 06Entertainment in Blakedown
page.content: There are a few sources of entertainment. One is Theatre 282, an {amateur dramatic society,}which performs three times a year and gives opportunities to act or spectate. During the winter months, the young population can attend{discos,}which are dances where recorded popular music is played. They are held at the Parish Room which can also be hired out for a nominal charge. Public or private functions take place including Women's Institute, wedding receptons and various fund raising activities. The{Annual Fete,}which is held in September, is the main event of the year. Usually the whole village attends and the proceeds are divided between worthy organisations within the village.
